newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese shares end mixed, BES surges 5.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese shares end mixed, BES surges 5.4 pct.

text.p: 1630 GMT - Portuguese shares and futures on the PSI20 index of 20 leading stocks and on Portugal Telecom ended mixed, but some stocks shone, including BES, Inparsa and Sonae Industria. Banco Espirito Santo (BES) surged 5.4 percent amid optimism over the bank's strong first half results, while the Belmiro de Azevedo group's Inparsa and Sonae Industria climbed sharply amid expectations, later confirmed, that Inparsa, the main shareholder in Sonae Industria, will be the vehicle for the Azevedo group's participation in a bid to win Portugal's third mobile phone licence.
* Foreign sell orders caused retailer Jeronimo Martins to drop by more than six percent, dealers said.
* Dealers said the trend on Lisbon bourse tomorrow would depend on the close of the New York stock market today.
"Some stocks remain bullish, but the local market ended flat today. The less sunny trend abroad could weigh on the Lisbon bourse tomorrow," said one operator.
